intro: Rhodochiton nubicola, commonly known as the cloud's delight, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found growing in rocky or forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its native range.
